subject: RE: Junit and JDK 1.4.2
msgSnippet: Both function do the something. The only different is that JDK1.4 assertion will only be turn on with the -ea flag when running JVM.  Otherwise, it is
messageBody:
Both function do the something. The only different is that JDK1.4 assertion will only be turn on with the -ea flag when running JVM. Otherwise, it is transparency to the user.

Henry

-----Original Message-----
From: marymj2000 [mailto:marymj2000@...]
Sent: Friday, November 05, 2004 4:52 AM
To: Henry Chan
Subject: Re: Junit and JDK 1.4.2



hi,
can anyone tell me the difference in assersion which is introduced in
JDK 1.4 and JUnit.
Thanks
MJ

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Henry Chan" <hchan@l...> wrote:
> You need to change
> assert(...) method
> to
> assertTrue(...)
>
> Henry
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Ranjeet Sahay [mailto:rsahay@s...]
> Sent: Thursday, September 04, 2003 9:31 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Junit and JDK 1.4.2
>
>
> Hi,
>
> Working on JUnit on JDK 1.4.2 it gives certain warning about assert
methods.
> I know this method has been introduced from JDK1.4 onwards.
> Should they affect my JUnit assertion in anyway?
>
> Thanks
>
> Ranjeet Sahay.
>
>
> "J. B. Rainsberger" wrote:
>
> > Karthikeyan Ramnath wrote:
> >
> > >
> > > Hi, has anyone tried using JUnit on JDK 1.4.2? I get a strange
problem that
> > > my menus and certain other components are not found by the
finder anymore!!!
> > > The same code works fine on 1.4.1_x versions...
> > > Eagerly awaiting some response.
> >
> > I don't understand what /your/ menus and other components have to
do
> > with JUnit. Can you be more concrete about your problem?
> > --
> > J. B. Rainsberger,
